newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki ends higher but confused as Lebed to go.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki ends higher but confused as Lebed to go.

text.p: Shares hit year-highs intra session and ended on stronger ground, but late reports that Russian security chief Alexander Lebed was sacked by president Boris Yeltsin left confusion, brokers said.

The HEX index ended up 0.63 percent, finally scraping to a new closing year-high of 2,236.1 with volume a sturdy 400 million markka, about 24 percent of it in Nokia which closed up 4.80 markka at 212.80.
The HEX's previous year-high was 2,226.6 set on October 8.
But brokers said the underlying trend should still be up.
"The trend is still good ... but there was the Lebed news, and we don't know if it's good or bad," said one.

Interim results from UPM-Kymmene and Metsa-Serla offered no positive surprises to those hoping for a fast recovery in forestries, but the shares rose and stayed in positive territory as the January-August profits were partly better than expected.
Unless Wall Street upsets investors, more gains were seen possible, particularly if Merita resumed a recent rally, but some warned that bulls could soon hit the edge of the pen.
"This is pretty much a bull market ... it looks like it always does before it halts completely," said one broker. "Shares are vulnerable now if interest rates rise," he said.
